page.title: 09 FILBOROUGH FARM
page.content: Filborough farm is situated near to Shorne marshes. It covers 60 acres of land and is used mostly for corn, wheat and vegetables. Mr Merritt, the farmer, does not own the farm but rents it from the Kent County Council. He does not employ any workers on the farm, but uses contractors to do a lot of the work at certain times of the year. There are also 8 long greenhouses on the farm for growing lettuces, tomatoes and peppers. The corn that he produces is sold to corn merchants to make malt beer or to dairy farmers as livestock feed. The wheat is sold to mills for bread making. The vegetables are mainly sold locally but many are also taken to market in London and often end up in supermarkets. Mr Merritt said that 1985 has been a good growing year.
